alert.note: Alert for Spotsylvania; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 2:27AM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Rappahannock River at Fredericksburg affecting Stafford and Spotsylvania Counties. For the Rappahannock River...including Remington, Fredericksburg, Fredericksburg...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rappahannock River at Fredericksburg. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water enters a basement at a home near Fredericksburg City Dock. Old Mill Park begins to flood and will be closed. Water enters a guest house off Caroline Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Tue Tue Tue Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7AM 1PM 7PM Stg Time Date Rappahannock River Fredericksburg 13.0 MSG unknown MSG MSG MSG 13.0 7pm Wed &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1030 AM EST.
